blocks.content: Pokémon Game — A React App with Local API for Learning and Play.

This project is a custom-built React app I created for my son, designed to make exploring Pokémon cards fun and interactive. It features a searchable card interface, character quizzes, and simple games — all tailored to spark curiosity and engagement.

Under the hood, the app connects to a locally hosted API on my home server, which serves card data and image mappings from a SQLite database. This setup gave me hands-on experience with full-stack integration, including API design, database management, and dynamic rendering in React.

The project was also a personal learning tool: I built it while preparing to lead a major React initiative at work, using it to deepen my comfort with component architecture, state handling, and responsive design — all in a context that was both technically challenging and personally meaningful.
